member.name: T:ScriptCoreLib.ActionScript.flash.display.DisplayObject
member.summary: The DisplayObject class is the base class for all objects that can be placed on the display list. The display list manages all objects displayed in Flash Player or Adobe AIR. Use the DisplayObjectContainer class to arrange the display objects in the display list. DisplayObjectContainer objects can have child display objects, while other display objects, such as Shape and TextField objects, are "leaf" nodes that have only parents and siblings, no children.

member.summary: http://ee.php.net/variables.predefined

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.Server
member.summary: Variables set by the web server or otherwise directly related to the execution environment of the current script. Analogous to the old $HTTP_SERVER_VARS array (which is still available, but deprecated).

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.Get
member.summary: Variables provided to the script via URL query string. Analogous to the old $HTTP_GET_VARS array (which is still available, but deprecated).

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.Post
member.summary: Variables provided to the script via HTTP POST. Analogous to the old $HTTP_POST_VARS array (which is still available, but deprecated).

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.Cookie
member.summary: Variables provided to the script via HTTP cookies. Analogous to the old $HTTP_COOKIE_VARS array (which is still available, but deprecated).

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.Files
member.summary: Variables provided to the script via HTTP post file uploads. Analogous to the old $HTTP_POST_FILES array (which is still available, but deprecated). See POST method uploads for more information.

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.Env
member.summary: Variables provided to the script via the environment. Analogous to the old $HTTP_ENV_VARS array (which is still available, but deprecated).

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.Request
member.summary: Variables provided to the script via the GET, POST, and COOKIE input mechanisms, and which therefore cannot be trusted. The presence and order of variable inclusion in this array is defined according to the PHP variables_order configuration directive. This array has no direct analogue in versions of PHP prior to 4.1.0. See also import_request_variables().

member.name: P:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.Globals
member.summary: Contains a reference to every variable which is currently available within the global scope of the script. The keys of this array are the names of the global variables. $GLOBALS has existed since PHP 3.

member.name: P:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.Session
member.summary: Variables which are currently registered to a script's session. Analogous to the old $HTTP_SESSION_VARS array (which is still available, but deprecated). See the Session handling functions section for more information.

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.PHP_SELF
member.summary: The filename of the currently executing script, relative to the document root. For instance, $_SERVER['PHP_SELF'] in a script at the address http://example.com/test.php/foo.bar would be /test.php/foo.bar. The __FILE__ constant contains the full path and filename of the current (i.e. included) file.

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.argv
member.summary: Array of arguments passed to the script. When the script is run on the command line, this gives C-style access to the command line parameters. When called via the GET method, this will contain the query string.

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.argc
member.summary: Contains the number of command line parameters passed to the script (if run on the command line).

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.GATEWAY_INTERFACE
member.summary: What revision of the CGI specification the server is using; i.e. 'CGI/1.1'.

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.SERVER_NAME
member.summary: The name of the server host under which the current script is executing. If the script is running on a virtual host, this will be the value defined for that virtual host.

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.SERVER_SOFTWARE
member.summary: Server identification string, given in the headers when responding to requests.

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.SERVER_PROTOCOL
member.summary: Name and revision of the information protocol via which the page was requested; i.e. 'HTTP/1.0';

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.REQUEST_METHOD
member.summary: Which request method was used to access the page; i.e. 'GET', 'HEAD', 'POST', 'PUT'.

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.REQUEST_TIME
member.summary: The timestamp of the start of the request. Available since PHP 5.1.0.

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.QUERY_STRING
member.summary: The query string, if any, via which the page was accessed.

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.DOCUMENT_ROOT
member.summary: The document root directory under which the current script is executing, as defined in the server's configuration file.

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.HTTP_ACCEPT
member.summary: Contents of the Accept: header from the current request, if there is one.

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.HTTP_ACCEPT_CHARSET
member.summary: Contents of the Accept-Charset: header from the current request, if there is one. Example: 'iso-8859-1,*,utf-8'.

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.HTTP_ACCEPT_ENCODING
member.summary: Contents of the Accept-Encoding: header from the current request, if there is one. Example: 'gzip'.

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.HTTP_ACCEPT_LANGUAGE
member.summary: Contents of the Accept-Language: header from the current request, if there is one. Example: 'en'.

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.HTTP_CONNECTION
member.summary: Contents of the Connection: header from the current request, if there is one. Example: 'Keep-Alive'.

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.HTTP_HOST
member.summary: Contents of the Host: header from the current request, if there is one.

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.HTTP_REFERER
member.summary: The address of the page (if any) which referred the user agent to the current page. This is set by the user agent. Not all user agents will set this, and some provide the ability to modify HTTP_REFERER as a feature. In short, it cannot really be trusted.

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.HTTP_USER_AGENT
member.summary: Contents of the User-Agent: header from the current request, if there is one. This is a string denoting the user agent being which is accessing the page. A typical example is: Mozilla/4.5 [en] (X11; U; Linux 2.2.9 i586). Among other things, you can use this value with get_browser() to tailor your page's output to the capabilities of the user agent.

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.HTTPS
member.summary: Set to a non-empty value if the script was queried through the HTTPS protocol.

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.REMOTE_ADDR
member.summary: The IP address from which the user is viewing the current page.

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.REMOTE_HOST
member.summary: The Host name from which the user is viewing the current page. The reverse dns lookup is based off the REMOTE_ADDR of the user.

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.REMOTE_PORT
member.summary: The port being used on the user's machine to communicate with the web server.

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.SCRIPT_FILENAME
member.summary: The absolute pathname of the currently executing script.

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.SERVER_ADMIN
member.summary: The value given to the SERVER_ADMIN (for Apache) directive in the web server configuration file. If the script is running on a virtual host, this will be the value defined for that virtual host.

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.SERVER_PORT
member.summary: The port on the server machine being used by the web server for communication. For default setups, this will be '80'; using SSL, for instance, will change this to whatever your defined secure HTTP port is.

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.SERVER_SIGNATURE
member.summary: String containing the server version and virtual host name which are added to server-generated pages, if enabled.

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.PATH_TRANSLATED
member.summary: Filesystem- (not document root-) based path to the current script, after the server has done any virtual-to-real mapping.

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.SCRIPT_NAME
member.summary: Contains the current script's path. This is useful for pages which need to point to themselves. The __FILE__ constant contains the full path and filename of the current (i.e. included) file.

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.REQUEST_URI
member.summary: The URI which was given in order to access this page; for instance, '/index.html'.

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.PHP_AUTH_DIGEST
member.summary: When running under Apache as module doing Digest HTTP authentication this variable is set to the 'Authorization' header sent by the client (which you should then use to make the appropriate validation).

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.PHP_AUTH_USER

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.PHP_AUTH_PW

member.name: F:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.SuperGlobals.ServerVariables.AUTH_TYPE
member.summary: When running under Apache as module doing HTTP authenticated this variable is set to the authentication type.

member.name: M:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.API.ob_end_flush
member.summary: This function will send the contents of the topmost output buffer (if any) and turn this output buffer off. If you want to further process the buffer's contents you have to call ob_get_contents() before ob_end_flush() as the buffer contents are discarded after ob_end_flush() is called. The function returns TRUE when it successfully discarded one buffer and FALSE otherwise. Reasons for failure are first that you called the function without an active buffer or that for some reason a buffer could not be deleted (possible for special buffer).

member.name: M:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.API.ob_end_clean
member.summary: This function discards the contents of the topmost output buffer and turns off this output buffering. If you want to further process the buffer's contents you have to call ob_get_contents() before ob_end_clean() as the buffer contents are discarded when ob_end_clean() is called. The function returns TRUE when it successfully discarded one buffer and FALSE otherwise. Reasons for failure are first that you called the function without an active buffer or that for some reason a buffer could not be deleted (possible for special buffer).

member.name: M:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.API.ob_clean
member.summary: This function discards the contents of the output buffer.

member.name: M:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.API.clearstatcache
member.summary: When you use stat(), lstat(), or any of the other functions listed in the affected functions list (below), PHP caches the information those functions return in order to provide faster performance. However, in certain cases, you may want to clear the cached information. For instance, if the same file is being checked multiple times within a single script, and that file is in danger of being removed or changed during that script's operation, you may elect to clear the status cache. In these cases, you can use the clearstatcache() function to clear the information that PHP caches about a file.

member.summary: Identical to file(), except that file_get_contents() returns the file in a string, starting at the specified offset up to maxlen bytes. On failure, file_get_contents() will return FALSE.

member.name: M:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.API.serialize(System.Object)
member.summary: serialize() returns a string containing a byte-stream representation of value that can be stored anywhere.

member.name: M:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.API.unserialize(System.String)
member.summary: unserialize() takes a single serialized variable (see serialize()) and converts it back into a PHP value. The converted value is returned, and can be a boolean, integer, float, string, array or object. In case the passed string is not unserializeable, FALSE is returned and E_NOTICE is issued.

member.name: M:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.API.ob_start
member.summary: This function will turn output buffering on. While output buffering is active no output is sent from the script (other than headers), instead the output is stored in an internal buffer.

member.name: M:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.API.ob_get_clean
member.summary: This will return the contents of the output buffer and end output buffering. If output buffering isn't active then FALSE is returned. ob_get_clean() essentially executes both ob_get_contents() and ob_end_clean().

member.name: M:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.API.exit
member.summary: The exit() function terminates execution of the script. It prints status just before exiting.

member.name: M:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.API.var_dump(System.Object)
member.summary: This function displays structured information about one or more expressions that includes its type and value. Arrays and objects are explored recursively with values indented to show structure.

member.name: M:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.API.ord(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the ASCII value of the first character of string. This function complements chr().

member.name: M:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.API.dechex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a string containing a hexadecimal representation of the given number argument. The largest number that can be converted is 4294967295 in decimal resulting to "ffffffff".

member.name: M:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.API.hexdec(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the decimal equivalent of the hexadecimal number represented by the hex_string argument. hexdec() converts a hexadecimal string to a decimal number. The largest number that can be converted is 7fffffff or 2147483647 in decimal. As of PHP 4.1.0, this function can also convert larger numbers. It returns float in that case.

member.name: M:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.API.htmlspecialchars(System.String)
member.summary: Certain characters have special significance in HTML, and should be represented by HTML entities if they are to preserve their meanings. This function returns a string with some of these conversions made; the translations made are those most useful for everyday web programming. If you require all HTML character entities to be translated, use htmlentities() instead.

member.name: M:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Native.API.htmlentities(System.String)
member.summary: This function is identical to htmlspecialchars() in all ways, except with htmlentities(), all characters which have HTML character entity equivalents are translated into these entities.

member.summary: Returns a positive LDAP link identifier on success, or FALSE on error. When OpenLDAP 2.x.x is used, ldap_connect() will always return a resource as it does not actually connect but just initializes the connecting parameters. The actual connect happens with the next calls to ldap_* funcs, usually with ldap_bind().

member.name: M:ScriptCoreLib.PHP.Net.LDAPClient.API.ldap_explode_dn(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: ldap_explode_dn() function is used to split the DN returned by ldap_get_dn() and breaks it up into its component parts. Each part is known as Relative Distinguished Name, or RDN. ldap_explode_dn() returns an array of all those components. with_attrib is used to request if the RDNs are returned with only values or their attributes as well. To get RDNs with the attributes (i.e. in attribute=value format) set with_attrib to 0 and to get only values set it to 1.
